TopicTitle: [Bug] No Fuel and Kerbal Icon after save not loading

Articles.Content:
Hey guys,

seems like my save got corrupted after ~2 hours of playtime. I did load save a game before attempting a mun landing and as you can see there is no fuel in the craft anymore.

Not sure what exactly caused this. I will try to provide the log and search for the save on my disc.

 

Logfile: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jYBR57PhnV29TFTCokdSKSmN8I_LTQpk/view?usp=sharing

Save: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YlMgeTaxP_YWkv1lsEFG49sEW7jcV2gp/view?usp=share_link

 

Hope this report does help for improving the game.

I think there should be a "Report a bug" feature inside the game which will take a screenshot, collect the log and send the save with it. Each additional file select or unselectable via checkbox.

 

Anyone searching the savefile location just take a look at "%appdata%\..\LocalLow\Intercept Games\Kerbal Space Program 2\Saves\SinglePlayer".

Edited February 24, 2023 by Xanatos
Corrected title, added savegame, added additional info
I have similar issues while running missions, sometimes the fuel just straight up goes missing in a stage.
For anyone wondering like me why there is no Feedback button in the game. There is one in the launcher but super hard to see.

Should be moved to the bug section https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/forum/144-ksp2-bug-reports/ since I have no clue how to do this would be nice if a moderator could  be so nice.

 

Thank you very much.
Thread moved from KSP 2 Discussion to KSP 2 Bug Reports.

On 2/24/2023 at 9:31 PM, Xanatos said:

For anyone wondering like me why there is no Feedback button in the game. There is one in the launcher but super hard to see.

 

Wow that's tiny. I thought it was a chat icon or something
Yep and I do use a Full HD Monitor, curious how large it will be on 2k or 4k

Worth noting that the fuel does NOT disappear after reloading. It just isn't properly indicated. Once you begin a burn, the bar will refresh and show the proper fuel quantity. So it's simply a case of the value not being properly initialised when the vehicle is loaded.

16 minutes ago, WingC3 said:

Worth noting that the fuel does NOT disappear after reloading. It just isn't properly indicated. Once you begin a burn, the bar will refresh and show the proper fuel quantity. So it's simply a case of the value not being properly initialised when the vehicle is loaded.

I encounterd that multiple times just like you described but in this special situation the engines did not start they did make the enlight animation but did not turn on.

I never encountered the bug like this all other ecnounters where just like you described it.
